hb.math.graph
Class Edge

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--hb.math.graph.Edge
Direct Known Subclasses:
Sepset
public class Edge
extends java.lang.Object

An edge is a pair of vertices; (u,v), where u,v belongs to V and u!=v in the graph G=(V,E). If (u,v) is an edge in a directed graph, we say that (u,v) is incident from or leaves vertex u and is incident to or enters vertex v. If (u,v) is an edge in a undirected graph, we say that (u,v) is incident on vertex u and v.
If (u,v) is an edge in a graph, we say that v is adjacent to vertex u. When a graph is undirected, the adjacency relation is symmetric. When the graph is directed, the adjacency relation is not necessarily symmetric.

See Also:
"[CorLeiRiv1990, pp86]", Graph, Vertex

public java.lang.String getTypeString()
